eu.amidst.core.datastream

Interface DataInstance

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Assignment
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataInstanceFromDataRow

    public interface DataInstance
extends Assignment
    The DataInstance interface represents a data sample. A DataStream object consists of a collection of DataInstance objects, which can be seen as specific assignments of the Attribute objects.

    To simplify the use of the DataInstance interface across the toolbox, it inherits from the Assignment interface. Hence, it can be also interpreted as an assignment to some Variable objects. This variable objects have associated an Attribute object. So, a DataInstance object can be queried either using anAttribute object or a Variable object.

    For an example of use follow this link

    http://amidst.github.io/toolbox/CodeExamples.html#datastreamsexample

    For further details about the implementation of this class using Java 8 functional-style programming look at the following paper:

    Masegosa et al. Probabilistic Graphical Models on Multi-Core CPUs using Java 8. IEEE-CIM (2015).

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        default double getValue(Variable var)
        Returns the value assigned to a given variable.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Assignment
        Parameters:
        var - the Variable object we want to query.
        Returns:
        the assigned value to the given variable. Returns a Double.NaN if the variable does not exist in the assignment.

      • setValue

        default void setValue(Variable var,
                      double value)
        Sets the value assigned to a variable. If the value already exists, then the value is updated accordingly.
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface Assignment
        Parameters:
        var - the Variable object to which the value will be assigned.
        value - the value that will be assigned to the Variable.

      • getVariables

        default java.util.Set<Variable> getVariables()
        Returns the set of variables included in the assignment.
        Specified by:
        getVariables in interface Assignment
        Returns:
        a valid set of variables.

      • outputString

        default java.lang.String outputString()
        Defines a default implementation of the "toString()" method. It produces a String that details all the variables and their corresponding values stored in this Assignment. The String starts with "{" and ends with "}". E.g., {A=0, B=2, C=0}.
        Specified by:
        outputString in interface Assignment
        Returns:
        a String object describing this Assignment.

      • getAttributes

        Attributes getAttributes()
        Returns the set of attributes that have assigned values stored in this DataInstance.
        Returns:
        a valid Attributes object.

      • getValue

        double getValue(Attribute att)
        Returns the value of a given Attribute stored in this DataInstance.
        Parameters:
        att - the Attribute object we want to query and extract its value.
        Returns:
        the assigned value of the given Attribute. Returns a Double.NaN if the attribute is not observed in this assignment.

      • setValue

        void setValue(Attribute att,
              double val)
        Sets the value of a given Attribute in this DataInstance. If the value is already included, then its value is updated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        att - the Attribute object to which the value will be assigned.
        val - the value that will be assigned.

      • toArray

        double[] toArray()
        Returns the values of this DataInstance in the form of an Array of doubles.
        Returns:
        an array of values.
